content.question: On a given day, the number of people, in thousands, that have entered a museum is modeled by the function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> given by <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals 4.217 inverse tan open parentheses 0.7 t minus 0.026 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4.217</mn><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>0.7</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>0.026</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is measured in hours and <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 8"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></math>. Based on the model, at what time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> did person number <math alttext="4000"><mn>4000</mn></math> enter the museum?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
